question: Format answer for: Regarding patient 'BIII-8' from family 'Family B': What is the original alias or alternate notation for the first mutation as reported in the article?
context:
Based on the information in the provided document, the mutation found in patient BIII-8 is p.D620N.

The article provides an alternate notation for this mutation on page 2, in the second paragraph of the main text (left column), stating: "Mutation of c.1858G>A (p.D620N) was identified...".
Also, in the "Genetic Analysis" section on page 2, it mentions: "...SPD patients and control subjects were also genotyped for c.1858G>A (p.D620N) mutation...".

Therefore, the original alias or alternate notation for the first (and only reported) mutation for patient BIII-8 as reported in the article is **c.1858G>A**.
